_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Caljet of America
Phoenix Terminal

RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Caljet of America - Phoenix Terminal in Phoenix, AZ is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. Caljet of America believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, the Phoenix Terminal will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All Caljet of America employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.

The Phoenix Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the community in which it operates. Caljet of America promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

Caljet of America - Phoenix Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Phoenix, AZ. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, diesel fuel, and additives. The Phoenix Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses the Butane unloading station, Butane storage vessels, valves, pump and associated piping. Butane is stored in two vessels and transferred to/blended with gasoline (product rack injection) through the us

e of a fixed piping system and injection skid.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS

Caljet of America's accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by the facility's regulated substance to employees/contractors, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Phoenix Terminal:
1) Employee Participation,
2) Process Safety Information,
3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA),
4) Standard Operating Procedures,
5) Operator Training,
6) Contractors,
7) Pre-startup Safety Review,
8) Mechanical Integrity,
9) Hazardous Work Authorization (Hot Work, etc.),
10) Management of Change,
11) Incident Investigation,
12) Emergency Procedures/Planning,
13) Compliance Audits, and
14) Trade Secrets.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

As this is a new process/stationary system there have been no accidents within the past five (5) years as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.42.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Phoenix Terminal Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Caljet of America is continually striving to make the Phoenix Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors and community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Phoenix Terminal is to demonstrate c

ontinuous improvement in its health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, Caljet of America will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Phoenix Terminal and surrounding community.
